But I have fun so.
very fun game really funny to play with. Your friends not for kids

Itâ€™s totally worth it! The game has so much potential as well.. I play with randoms all the time and itâ€™s still fun. Met some new friends that goes crazy last night it was hilarious. Had a good hour of fun where we make bet the one who win get a free steam games hahah
Fun game to play with friends and might help u in polishing your card skills

Good game. Best suited for those who have a few friends, but also have agreat time alone. If you want to have fun with friends and kill time, i advise you to play Liar Bar. I recommend it to everyone!!! One of the best games for riends in recent years.

if you want the experience of being lied to and wanting to beat your screen play this game if you have any sort of a will to live don't play it
Fun game with some good buds! Nice game to return to from time to time.
A very fun game to play with friends. Easy to pick up and always leads to a lot of laughs

Game talks about being "remastered" yet doesn't run and glitchy.. Sucks I got excited for the game as it looks like a lot of fun and was really cheap to buy, I do like the inclusion of the different characters, skins and back stories. was nice only wish it would load past the warnings at the beginning of the game. will recommend but the part of it not loading needs to be fixed.
Fun as fuck game, but the A.I. voices kinda suck. Hire some real VA's and it'll be absolute peak,
Awesome with friends. always a good time screaming at and flipping off your friends.

A highly creative and innovative game, perfect for playing with two or three friends! 
Highly recommended!! 
However, the drawback is that if you play only yourself, you'll encounter a lot of cheaters and the network connection is also sometimes unstable. 
Therefore, it's not a game recommended to play alone.

Very very fun game, straight up. No Notes.

10000% worth the price, just buy it.

Do make sure you have friends to play with though, that's whats funnest for me.

You should be a professional liar to win this game â€” and thatâ€™s exactly why itâ€™s so much fun. Liar Bar turns every round into a fast, hilarious battle of bluffing, reading people, and keeping your cool under pressure.

The social interaction is the real highlight: youâ€™ll laugh, accuse, panic, and try to convince everyone youâ€™re telling the truth (even when you definitely arenâ€™t). With the right group, itâ€™s pure chaotic entertainment.

If you enjoy deception games and big drama moments, Liar Bar is absolutely worth playing.

Liarâ€™s Bar is a standout in the deception-game genre. It masterfully blends social bluffing, risk, and fun character work, creating a tight, addictive experience that encourages both cunning play and daring gambits. The recent graphical revamp is a major win â€” not only does it polish the atmosphere, but it also fixes practical issues that improve the overall experience.

If you enjoy party games with a psychological twist (and you donâ€™t mind the occasional bug, given itâ€™s in Early Access), Liarâ€™s Bar is absolutely worth checking out. The tension, the art, the risk â€” everything comes together to make a truly memorable bluffing playground.
Very cool and funny game to play with your friends!
Add more games such as blackjack, poker, etc. Also, add more characters with additional attributes
Hope devs will continue regularly support this game with new content!
Fun game if you have friends to play with. Randoms are hit and miss

Need more skins, locations and games, overall the game is ok.

Great game with friends. Lots of laughs and genuinely entertaining.

In Liar's Bar, you will have your tongue tested and trust broken by friends as you bluff your way out in a series of card and dice games where skill, perfidy and a little bit of luck culminate in thrilling and memorable matchups.

A lot of new content has been introduced but I started playing it when it was first released and I will have to say this is one of the best card games out there to play right now currently. It introduces new modes and new risks that make it fun and interesting to play than your typical card game where here instead of losing your hand you lose your life lol by gun, posion, or by your opponent/friend with the gun lol. So yeah if you like gambling this is definitely for you :))
so addictive and fun game. specially with friends!

Itâ€™s a fun and good game, but it has a lot of problems â€” it crashes sometimes. Even though itâ€™s a simple game, it uses a lot of my PCâ€™s performance, even when I set everything to low. I think they should work on optimizing it, but in the end, itâ€™s still worth trying.

Liarâ€™s Bar is a hilarious, chaotic multiplayer bluffing game thatâ€™s perfect with friends. The card and dice modes are easy to pick up, and the moments of calling out lies or being caught are pure fun. The quirky characters and bar-themed style add charm, and matches are quick and replayable.
Really fun and relaxing game, great to play with friends as well very high recommendation!

negative.review:
It's not that I don't like the game, it's very fun.  My main issue is I can't play it for more than a few minutes without getting nauseous because of the unnecessary and unstoppable head bobbing your character does.  I just gave the game another shot (no pun intended) and two games in and I have to stop.  I saw one steam review comment from the developer saying that the change is impossible because the camera is based on the character's physics.  

I find this to be a poor excuse.  A simple answer would be to create a character that doesn't move like that exclusively for people who experience motion sickness like that.  An additional option would be to make a separate camera that is third person, or first person but stationary, and is a toggleable option in the menu.

This is the only game that I own that does this.  It is a completely separate issue from the game itself, which is why I don't understand why the devs are forcing it.  The games themselves are a great time and I do enjoy playing them, and I do want to play more, but I cannot while this issue persists.  I type this while dizzy from just playing the game.

I respectfully implore the devs to think of their playerbase as I uninstall the game.

Either the online matchmaking is broken or there are no players. I was unable to get connected to any game types after multiple attempts.

Also, the main screen consists of an old-school TV pattern that obscures the text on the screen, making it difficult to select menu options. Such a basic oversight, even in early access, grants zero confidence in the developers.
Leaving this review purely because of the "god saved him" mechanic completely ending all interest I had in this game as a new player.

Game isn't that bad in terms of fun, design, and smaller things. But reporting needing to be done officially instead of filling something out is a bit of a bummer. First game of matchmaking, person uses one bullet instead of 3 twice, made me survive an all in, and froze the match.

cool but its more of a game to play while watching a movie or playing it on a mobile device. its a card game so the pacing is turn by turn slowly. i stuck around to see the additions and changes but honestly its the same game. theres texas holdem, liars poker where you drop a card and say its a certain card. and liars dice where you all roll dice and bet on what everyone at the table could have.

I think the game is cool, some modes are occasionally frustrating but that's just the nature of the game. But I don't recommend it for its price and here's why:

- Too few players for matchmaking: The game has around 600-800 active players. Most of them are not from the same region so matchmaking inevitably cross-matches players. This leads to bugs and renders the voice chat obsolete

- Game breaking boundary mechanics: Some mechanics completely break a match or provide a second chance to players who should've lost. I'll list some below:
      - In liar's deck if someone calls liar just before their timer runs out, they will call liar to the cards that they  threw. This allows them to throw a lie and call their own lie to make the next player take a shot. Though not commonly used, it is an issue that exists.
      - In Liar's poker if someone leaves just after showdown but before the gun loading starts, other players who had inferior hands will never initiate the gun loading and get another chance. Supposedly this was fixed in the most recent hotfix but it still occurs. Maybe the devs didn't patch some alt+f4 cases. I don't know...
      - In Liar's poker, someone can just switch a card and go all in. Most of the time they make a one-pair with whichever card is in the flop and already get a >85% chance of winning. Either the switching mechanic should be removed or all the players should get an opporunity to switch before deicing whether to go all in or fold. 25% chance is too high to fold every single time.   
     - In Liar's poker there is a rare but possible boundary case where if someone disconnects just before showdown happens, the new hands get distributed but the remaining players throw their NEW hands in the middle for all players to see. Effectively giving a free round to those who folded.

I think the game should go on a big sale to encourage an increase in player base.

And instead of adding goon gamemodes, maybe make an airtight system first. Also speed up some animations, the game feels very chunky.

And lastly, optimize the game. Getting 45-50fps with a gtx1650ti in a unity game with very small environments is just not a good look.
This used to be an awesome game , Now its full of Asian cheaters . Stay away toxic community !!!!

Great idea, bad implemented. Personally, I bought it because I was curious about the poker with russian roulette game. I played it a few times with some friends and found it quite fun, but the game is too "cluncky", not only the gameplay itself, but also the menu interface and stuff (still don't know why the game won't save my graphics/ audio settings) and VERY BAD optimized, in fact, it's so bad that it crashed my stream on Twitch twice (I've played quite heavier games and it never happened). If you want to buy it, be sure to have friends to play with and wait for a sale, definitely not worth full price.
The game won't load past the mental health loading screen.  Tired of wasting my time.

If this game wasn't bought for me as a gift, i'd refund it. Its one thing to have different random rules for each game mode, but the rules are vaguely explained so you can only really understand them by playing and losing to the specific mechanics. On top of that, half the time the rules don't even stay consistent in a single round of a given game mode, whether do to bugs or just secret mechanics that are unlisted.
Leaving this review purely because of the "god saved him" mechanic completely ending all interest I had in this game as a new player.

At first launch, game was okay. Nowadays it is all hackers, cheaters, and stuck lobbies that never load. Then after I wait for 10 minutes with nothing happening, I decide to leave. But don't worry, you'll still lose ranked points even though the lobby broke. Not worth playing anymore.
Game is okay but nothing crazy, but i havent finished a single ranked game in the last two days because the game is always crashing

This game currently has a massive problem with cheaters. There's no in-game report system, or even a way to connect to other player's steam profiles so you know to avoid them

Until it's fixed, hard avoid, as ranked matches are basically unplayable.
No cheating report function and the game is full of racist losers who team up on others based on country of origin. Company is trash for allowing this.
pls make an option to set the camera in fixed mode, the camera keeps wobbling in this game and it makes me feel sick and dizzy and severely shorten my gambling session because of it
fun game but cant play it with random people 90% a cheater is in the game throwing cards when its not his turn and making others shot them self  3 times per turn

Played a few games about a year ago so take my experiences with a grain of salt. I'll be reviewing mainly the Liar's Deck mode. The gameplay is overall fun (especially Liar's Deck) and the character designs are good but the community was pretty toxic. I remember during my few hours playing that I saw a blatantly racist lobby name in the US server and 1/3 of the players I played with were toxic jocks that would curse at me if I ever got lost with the controls (which happened a lot since I was still new) or stopped to try to type in chat since I wasn't comfortable using my mic. Overall, I haven't played this one in a year for a reason and if the community is still the same now as it was then, I would HIGHLY recommend you only play the game with friends, not strangers. Liar's Bar, for the brief period I played it, was the worst voice chat experience I ever had. I can't give a Neutral in terms of recommendations so I'll settle on No.
gambling game that never heard of maths. 4 queens on the table and one player claims "3 queeeeeens" - i call BS and he reveals his cards: 3 queens. How can there be 7 queens in this game?

Sadly the new update (which did not add a option to allow spectators to see the cards of other players) only added annoying sounds that are way too loud in some positions.

Otherwise a fun game.

This game is stupid.  25% of the time you will die all the time.  I guess someone is not good at math that made this game.  25% does not kill you everyyyyyyyyy time.  Get your math correct.  Bad game...

And lastly, optimize the game. Getting 45-50fps with a gtx1650ti in a unity game with very small environments is just not a good look.

Great idea, bad implemented. Personally, I bought it because I was curious about the poker with russian roulette game. I played it a few times with some friends and found it quite fun, but the game is too "cluncky", not only the gameplay itself, but also the menu interface and stuff (still don't know why the game won't save my graphics/ audio settings) and VERY BAD optimized, in fact, it's so bad that it crashed my stream on Twitch twice (I've played quite heavier games and it never happened). If you want to buy it, be sure to have friends to play with and wait for a sale, definitely not worth full price.
The game won't load past the mental health loading screen.  Tired of wasting my time.

If this game wasn't bought for me as a gift, i'd refund it. Its one thing to have different random rules for each game mode, but the rules are vaguely explained so you can only really understand them by playing and losing to the specific mechanics. On top of that, half the time the rules don't even stay consistent in a single round of a given game mode, whether do to bugs or just secret mechanics that are unlisted.
Leaving this review purely because of the "god saved him" mechanic completely ending all interest I had in this game as a new player.

At first launch, game was okay. Nowadays it is all hackers, cheaters, and stuck lobbies that never load. Then after I wait for 10 minutes with nothing happening, I decide to leave. But don't worry, you'll still lose ranked points even though the lobby broke. Not worth playing anymore.
Game is okay but nothing crazy, but i havent finished a single ranked game in the last two days because the game is always crashing

This game currently has a massive problem with cheaters. There's no in-game report system, or even a way to connect to other player's steam profiles so you know to avoid them

Until it's fixed, hard avoid, as ranked matches are basically unplayable.
No cheating report function and the game is full of racist losers who team up on others based on country of origin. Company is trash for allowing this.
pls make an option to set the camera in fixed mode, the camera keeps wobbling in this game and it makes me feel sick and dizzy and severely shorten my gambling session because of it
fun game but cant play it with random people 90% a cheater is in the game throwing cards when its not his turn and making others shot them self  3 times per turn

Played a few games about a year ago so take my experiences with a grain of salt. I'll be reviewing mainly the Liar's Deck mode. The gameplay is overall fun (especially Liar's Deck) and the character designs are good but the community was pretty toxic. I remember during my few hours playing that I saw a blatantly racist lobby name in the US server and 1/3 of the players I played with were toxic jocks that would curse at me if I ever got lost with the controls (which happened a lot since I was still new) or stopped to try to type in chat since I wasn't comfortable using my mic. Overall, I haven't played this one in a year for a reason and if the community is still the same now as it was then, I would HIGHLY recommend you only play the game with friends, not strangers. Liar's Bar, for the brief period I played it, was the worst voice chat experience I ever had. I can't give a Neutral in terms of recommendations so I'll settle on No.
gambling game that never heard of maths. 4 queens on the table and one player claims "3 queeeeeens" - i call BS and he reveals his cards: 3 queens. How can there be 7 queens in this game?

Sadly the new update (which did not add a option to allow spectators to see the cards of other players) only added annoying sounds that are way too loud in some positions.

Otherwise a fun game.

This game is stupid.  25% of the time you will die all the time.  I guess someone is not good at math that made this game.  25% does not kill you everyyyyyyyyy time.  Get your math correct.  Bad game...

Tang-O
fun with friends but public matchmaking is loaded with cheaters with no way to report, even though the game warns that cheaters will be banned

Either the online matchmaking is broken or there are no players. I was unable to get connected to any game types after multiple attempts.

Also, the main screen consists of an old-school TV pattern that obscures the text on the screen, making it difficult to select menu options. Such a basic oversight, even in early access, grants zero confidence in the developers.

Game isn't that bad in terms of fun, design, and smaller things. But reporting needing to be done officially instead of filling something out is a bit of a bummer. First game of matchmaking, person uses one bullet instead of 3 twice, made me survive an all in, and froze the match.

cool but its more of a game to play while watching a movie or playing it on a mobile device. its a card game so the pacing is turn by turn slowly. i stuck around to see the additions and changes but honestly its the same game. theres texas holdem, liars poker where you drop a card and say its a certain card. and liars dice where you all roll dice and bet on what everyone at the table could have. 

furry cardgame with sexualized bunny character.
